title: As a Trump supporter, do you wear a mask when you go out? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wear one wherever they are mandated or necessary to be able to remain within a location which I need or want to remain in, temporarily. (Such as in a store or other location; I don’t own the locale, therefore I don’t get to make the rules there, and as a Trump supporter I also respect other people’s property and requirements or wishes for being on their property, and I also don’t want to make anyone uncomfortable or cause a scene, etc). So for me that translates to: I wear one briefly while in Walgreens, Target, or any other store that really would either make you wear one or presumably ask you to leave if you won’t. I take it off the moment I’m out the door; I don’t wear it when I go into my local corner gas station because the East Indian attendants there don’t really care either way. I wore one at the doctor’s office waiting room for routine check-up the other day (and I think dr’s waiting rooms are an appropriate place for these, at the moment). I would wear one on a plane for now. I went to a friend’s wedding at a Greek Church the other weekend and they required one in the church during the ceremony so I wore one during the ceremony. I do not and will not wear one: while driving my car; while out walking around in any outdoor/open places outside; while exercising outside; while visiting in private with close family or a few select long-known old friends (as long as no one is feeling ill, coughing, and/or has not had any known recent ‘exposure’ event). And, at the aforementioned wedding a couple weeks ago (which was an entirely privately held affair with about 50 people), no one was really wearing them once the “reception” began, so neither did I. I wasn’t going to be the only one, that’s for sure. And I made it! Hand-washing and sanitizer before the food, no doubt, however. Oh boy, a survivable event, a wedding reception, and even a few plates from the open antipasto table. And to think my immediate ancestors only made it through world wars, a famine, previous pandemic(s), and Dachau.

I wear the ‘mask of the beast’ if the shop requires it; I mean we can’t buy or sell unless we wear the mask, so I’m compliant in that sense. However, if I get to a shop and no one in the shop is wearing a mask then I won’t wear a mask either; if I’m strolling in public, I won’t wear it - I teach my children the same. The mask is a tool of manipulation; it cannot prevent a virus from infecting you and the RT PCR test was not designed to test for viruses, so even the supposed cases are just cases of the test and not the virus, so I won’t even submit to testing; we were sick just last week, took our herbal remedies and are quite fine now. I ain’t gonna to willing submit to enslavement.

I follow CDC guidelines. I don’t wear a mask “when I go out” if I know that I will not be less than six feet from someone for more than 15 minutes. I do wear a mask if I am indoors or standing in line with people. I never wear a mask when alone or with my wife in a car or when walking the dog. I do always carry one with me, just in case.

I legally have to if I'm inside a building right now. Id much rather not, as I carry a firearm. Its very sketchy to walk into a place with a mask and gun, but hey, if I'm charged for it, I'll look to sue the city for passing the mask oridance, as they've infringed on my 2nd amendment rights. Would be a nice payday.

I don’t do it because of my political views. I wear a mask when I’m out and about because all the stores where I live have a mask mandate. You can’t go shopping in there unless you’re wearing one. I also can’t do anything like conducting business with other people unless masked, due to issues with the pandemic.

Yes, always unless I’m walking in my neighborhood or on a path, but I have it near me and put it on whenever I pass someone. I look at it this way - whether you believe it works or not, what is the harm in wearing it? I also sew masks so I’ve made hundreds of them. It’s a new fashion statement.😀

If I’m going into some place I will put one on. If I’m just going for a walk then no I’m confident in my ability to keep distance. It makes me feel like a moron to wear it. Either way we’re breathing the same air and it is airbourne.

I wear one because I am compelled to. In Harris County TX, our Nazi wannabe dictator county judge has decreed that we must wear a mask or we get fined. Masks are useless. We all know that. As a result, it should be OUR choice to wear a mas or not. Period.
I am definitely not a trump supporter, I always wear a mask and am militant about social distancing
Yes and No. In open air its not exactly shoulder to shoulder in my rural area. In stores we all wear mask. Some of our stores could have upward of ten people at any given time but we were mask.
No…this is still a free country. If I feel like I need one I’ll wear one…until then I won’t.
If a store requires one,I’ll wear one.I’m not going to give the store employees a hard time for doing their jobs.
Only when it is required to enter somewhere. What does being a Trump supporter have to do with it? I would not wear one unless required either way.
Yes I do wear a mask when I go out, as it’s mandated by State and local laws. I’m a Trump fan too.
I wear a mask only in places that require me too wear it. The moment I leave the building the mask comes off.
Only when I have to! It’s usually hanging off my sunglasses and draped across my face.
